alert.note: Alert for Adams; Logan (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 26 at 6:28PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Colorado, including the following counties, Adams, Logan, Morgan and Washington. * WHEN...Until 800 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 628 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southern Sterling, Fort Morgan, Brush, Log Lane Village, Merino, Hillrose, Gary, Adena School, Twelve-Mile Corner, Woodrow, Snyder, Midway, Adena, Antelope Springs, Shamrock, Prewitt Reservoir, Willard, Leader, Atwood and Fort Morgan Airport.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
